paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.148G>A (p.Val30Met) and associated penetrance data from a case report.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Late-onset, complicated spinal cord injury, progressive weakness and numbness of limbs.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 68-year-old man was diagnosed with the TTR c.148G>A (p.Val30Met) mutation by ultrasound, pathological, and genetic analyses.

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to misfolding of the TTR protein into amyloid fibrils, causing disease.

variants.segregation_data: Not assessed due to refusal of family members for genetic testing.
variants.additional_notes: The patient exhibited unusual symptoms of spinal cord injury, which is rare for this mutation.
key_quotes: The TTR gene c.148G>A (p.Val30Met) mutation is the most common mutation known to be associated with this disease.
The patient ultimately died of heart failure 7.5 years after the initial onset of symptoms.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a single case with a specific TTR variant.
